result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph George Grover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

11:55 AM Defendant Joseph G. Grover appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Joseph G. Grover.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court has discussion with DEF regarding proceeding with hearing by video, DEF agrees.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court. State states that both parties have reached a global, joint resolution (with 20CF248). State recites the agreement, all parties agree. DEF enters NC plea. Court acknowledges that the DEF knowingly, willingly, and intellectually has given his guilty plea. DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty. State no comment. DEF makes statement. Court has discussion with DEF. Court to follow agreement. Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with. Joint agreement 

COURT: Count 1 - No Contest. Withheld Sentence, 3 Years Probation. No Contact with SHP (dob: 07/14/1971).  AODA assessment within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations. Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through. Fines/Costs totaling $654.00
Count 2 - No Contest. Withheld Sentence,1 Year Probation. No Contact with SADA (dob: 03/03/1984).  AODA assessment within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations. Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through. Domestic Abuse Surcharge. Fines/Costs totaling $443.00 
Probations for Count 1 & 2 run concurrent. DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. 
Count 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 - Dismissed and Read - In
ATTACHMENT
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:43 AM Defendant Joseph G. Grover in court, in custody.   Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Joseph G. Grover. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates global offer has been received, Attny request adjournment to review with DEF, and set for sentencing at a later date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD / 10:03 AM Defendant Joseph George Grover appeared by video, in custody, from Barron County, with Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt.  Bruce Poquette appearing for State of WI.  Discussion among all parties on scheduling. Atty Thomas-Schmidt indicates SEHR needed in 20CF248, requests cases to track together.  Court sets STC (22CF37) / SEHR (20CF248) for 5/18/22 at 11:30AM.
Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:11AM Defendant Joseph George Grover in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt  acknowledges information, waives reading, enters NG plea on behalf of DEF.  DEF agrees.  Court enters NG plea, finds probable cause, and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets STC for 5/31/22 at 11AM.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on March 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:35 AM Defendant Joseph George Grover in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appears by zoom.  Defendant Joseph George Grover in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness LCO Officer Ian Junker, Court sworn in witness.   State begins examination.    9:39 AM Witness identified the DEF, Attny Thomas-Schmidt  no objection, Court indicates the record will reflect.   State continues examination.  9:43 AM  Cross-Examination by Attny Thomas-Schmidt.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt  no further questions.  9:44 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt  no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.  Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:04 AM Defendant Joseph George Grover in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt.  Defendant Joseph George Grover in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Counsel DEF enters NG Plea to Counts 2-7.   Through Attorney DEF set preliminary hearing within time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
